meanings.definition: To construct a building or buildings that are larger or more numerous than another.
meanings.sent1: The new school outbuilds the old one in size and classrooms.
meanings.sent2: The skyscraper outbuilds the small house in height and floors.
meanings.sent3: The ant outbuilds the beetle in creating tiny tunnels underground.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity outbuilds his when it comes to building sandcastles on the beach.
meanings.sent5: The beehive outbuilds the bird's nest in complexity and organization.

meanings.definition: To surpass in building or construction.
meanings.sent1: His Lego tower outbuilds his sister's in height and design.
meanings.sent2: The architect's vision outbuilds the client's expectations for the new building.
meanings.sent3: The competition to outbuild each other in sandcastle height was fierce.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed outbuilds any obstacles in her way.
meanings.sent5: The team's collaboration outbuilds individual efforts in completing the project on time.
